physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patient was a 51-year-old male with a history of smoking, hepatitis C, and tuberculosis. Presenting symptoms included cough and congestion. Chest X-ray suggested a lung mass; PET/CT confirmed a 4.3 x 3.0 cm necrotic mass in the right paratracheal region and a 4.2 x 3.7 cm necrotic mass occluding the right upper lobe bronchus. There were metastases to mediastinal and right supraclavicular nodes.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Post-treatment bronchoscopy showed that the right main stem bronchus was patent. The patient died of disease 14 months after presentation.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patient was a 52-year-old male with a history of emphysema and hepatitis C. During hospitalization, he had right lower quadrant pain and CT scan showed tumors in the right adrenal gland, right frontal lobe, right posterior cerebellum, and pole of the right upper lobe.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient is alive 37 months after presentation.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patient was a 64-year-old male with a history of emphysema. He presented after palpating a left neck mass. CT scan revealed a partially necrotic mass in the left upper lobe and a spiculated mass in the left half of the C2 vertebral body.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Post-treatment AFP level was 1 ng/ml and restaging detected metastatic disease in the liver. The patient died of disease 10 months after presentation.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patient was a 54-year-old female with pain localized to the lower left sternal border. Chest CT showed nodules in the left upper lobe and a costosternal mass that was metastatic adenocarcinoma of the lung.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: She had complete resolution of the metastatic costosternal mass after treatment and was alive 9 years after presentation.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patient was a 60-year-old male with emphysema, cough, weight loss, and muscle spasms. Chest X-ray revealed a large right upper lobe mass, and PET/CT showed heterogeneously enhancing multilobulated mass, with metastatic disease to lymph nodes and a brain mass.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient was alive 1 month after presentation.
